thread.title: Gators DB Deiondre Porter arrested on several charges

title: Gators DB Deiondre Porter arrested on several charges
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Gators DB Deiondre Porter arrested on several charges First Coast News and 10 News Staff 12:16 p.m. EDT October 14, 2015 Florida Gators DB, Deiondre Porter has been suspended from the team after being arrested on multiple charges. (Photo: Alachua County Jail) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
GAINESVILLE, Fla. ( First Coast News ) -- A Florida Gators defensive back has been suspended indefinitely after he was arrested on a long list of charges in Gainesville Wednesday morning. 
Deiondre Porter, 21, faces four felony counts including aggravated battery, aggravated assault with a deadly weapon, and shooting into a dwelling. He also faces a misdemeanor count. 
The redshirt freshman defensive back from Tampa was a key contributor to the Gators secondary this season. 
"His choice, not to be with us. It's one of those things we don't condone.", says Gators head coach Jim McElwain. 
The Tampa Bay Times reports that Porter is a graduate of Jefferson High School in Tampa and was arrested in June of 2014 for marijuana possession. Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1LtZtPm TOP VIDEOS
